document.title: Use Supabase with Next.js
document.description: Learn how to create a Supabase project, add some sample data to your database, and query the data from a Next.js app.

body.raw:
### What is Supabase? Supabase is currently in early-Alpha .It is an open-source Firebase alternative. It adds realtime and RESTful APIs to your PostgreSQL database without a single line of code. Supabase is a tool in the Realtime Backend / API category of a tech stack. Supabase is an open source tool with 52.4K GitHub stars and 4K GitHub forks. Hereâ€™s a link to Supabase's open source repository on GitHub Who uses Supabase? ## Get started ### 1. Set up a Supabase project with sample data [Create a new project](https://supabase.com/dashboard/projects) in the Supabase Dashboard. After your project is ready, create a table in your Supabase database using the [SQL Editor](https://supabase.com/dashboard/project/_/sql) in the Dashboard. Use the following SQL statement to create a `countries` table with some sample data. ```sql title="SQL_EDITOR" -- Create the table create table countries ( id serial primary key, name text not null ); -- Insert some sample data into the table insert into countries (name) values ('United States'); insert into countries (name) values ('Canada'); insert into countries (name) values ('Mexico'); ``` ### 2. Create a Next.js app Use the `create-next-app` command and the `with-supabase` template, to create a Next.js app pre-configured with: - [Supabase Auth](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-helpers/nextjs) - [TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/) - [Tailwind CSS](https://www.tailwindcss.com) ```bash title="Terminal" npx create-next-app -e with-supabase my-app && cd my-app ``` ### 3. Declare Supabase Environment Variables Rename `.env.local.example` to `.env.local` and populate with [your project's URL and Anon Key](https://supabase.com/dashboard/project/_/settings/api). ```env title=".env.local" NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=your-project-url NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your-anon-key ``` ### 4. Query Supabase data from Next.js Create a new file at `app/countries/page.tsx` and populate with the following. This will select all the rows from the `countries` table in Supabase and render them on the page. ```tsx title="app/countries/page.tsx" import { createServerComponentClient } from "@supabase/auth-helpers-nextjs"; import { cookies } from "next/headers"; export default async function Index() { const supabase = createServerComponentClient({ cookies }); const { data: countries } = await supabase.from("countries").select(); return (
    {countries?.map((country) => (
  • {country.name}
    • ))}
); } ``` ### 5. Start the app Run the development server, go to [http://localhost:3000/countries](http://localhost:3000/countries) in a browser and you should see the list of countries. ```bash title="Terminal" npm run dev ``` Get the full guide on [Supabase](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/getting-started/quickstarts/nextjs).

document.title: Why You Need a Good Website
document.description: Why You Need a Good Website
tags: why do we need a good web

body.raw:
<Image
  src="/images/blog/why-we-need-a-good-website/website.jpg"
  width={720}
  height={720}
/>

## Outline

1. Introduction
2. The Importance of a Strong Online Presence
   - Establishing Credibility and Trust
   - Expanding Your Reach
   - Enhancing Brand Awareness
3. Increasing Customer Engagement
   - Providing Information and Resources
   - Interactive Features and User Experience
4. Generating Leads and Driving Conversions
   - Lead Generation Strategies
   - Conversion Optimization Techniques
5. Improving Search Engine Visibility
   - SEO Best Practices
   - Content Marketing and Link Building
6. Competing in the Digital Landscape
   - Staying Ahead of the Competition
   - Adapting to Changing Consumer Behavior
7. Conclusion
8. FAQs

## Article

**Introduction**

In today's digital age, having a good website is no longer a luxury but a necessity for businesses and individuals alike. A well-designed and optimized website can make a significant difference in the success of your online endeavors. Whether you're a small business owner, a freelancer, or an aspiring blogger, a good website can serve as your virtual storefront, attracting visitors, engaging customers, and driving conversions. In this article, we will explore the reasons why having a good website is crucial in today's competitive online landscape.

**The Importance of a Strong Online Presence**

One of the primary reasons why you need a good website is to establish credibility and trust with your audience. In the digital realm, your website acts as a representation of your brand or business. A professional and visually appealing website instills confidence in your potential customers, giving them the assurance that you are a legitimate and trustworthy entity. Without a well-designed website, you risk losing customers to competitors who have already established a strong online presence.

Additionally, a good website enables you to expand your reach beyond geographical boundaries. With the internet breaking down barriers, you can reach a global audience and tap into new markets. By optimizing your website for search engines and leveraging social media platforms, you can attract visitors from all corners of the world, increasing your chances of acquiring new customers and growing your business.

Furthermore, a well-crafted website enhances brand awareness. Through consistent branding elements such as logos, color schemes, and unique messaging, your website becomes a powerful tool for brand recognition. When people come across your brand on various online channels, they will be more likely to remember and trust you, leading to increased brand loyalty and customer retention.

**Increasing Customer Engagement**

A good website provides a platform for you to engage with your customers and provide them with valuable information and resources. By creating informative blog posts, articles, or tutorials, you can establish yourself as an authority in your industry and build trust with your audience. Moreover, interactive features such as chatbots, contact forms, and forums allow visitors to ask questions, provide feedback, and engage in discussions, fostering a sense of community and strengthening customer relationships.

Furthermore, user experience plays a crucial role in customer engagement. A well-designed website with intuitive navigation, fast loading times, and responsive design ensures that visitors have a seamless browsing experience. When users can easily find the information they need and navigate through your website effortlessly, they are more likely to stay longer, explore more of your content, and ultimately take the desired actions, such as making a purchase or contacting you for further inquiries.

**Generating Leads and Driving Conversions**

A good website serves as a powerful lead generation and conversion tool. By implementing effective lead generation strategies such as offering free resources, providing incentives for newsletter subscriptions, or creating compelling call-to-action buttons, you can capture valuable leads and build a database of potential customers. With these leads in hand, you can nurture them through email marketing campaigns or personalized follow-ups, increasing the likelihood of converting them into paying customers.

Moreover, a well-optimized website employs conversion optimization techniques to maximize the chances of turning visitors into customers. This includes strategic placement of call-to-action buttons, clear and persuasive product descriptions, streamlined checkout processes, and trust signals such as customer testimonials and secure payment options. By continually testing and optimizing these elements, you can improve your conversion rates and ultimately boost your bottom line.

**Improving Search Engine Visibility**

In a crowded online space, having a good website that is search engine optimized is essential for gaining visibility and attracting organic traffic. Search engine optimization (SEO) involves implementing various strategies and techniques to improve your website's ranking in search engine results pages. This includes optimizing your website's structure, incorporating relevant keywords, creating high-quality content, and earning backlinks from reputable sources.

Additionally, content marketing plays a vital role in improving search engine visibility. By consistently creating valuable and shareable content, you can attract inbound links, increase social media engagement, and establish yourself as an authoritative source within your industry. When search engines recognize the quality and relevance of your content, they are more likely to rank your website higher, leading to increased visibility and organic traffic.

**Competing in the Digital Landscape**

Finally, having a good website is crucial for staying ahead of the competition in the digital landscape. With more businesses embracing the online realm, it's essential to have a website that sets you apart from the crowd. A visually appealing and user-friendly website can make a lasting impression on visitors, giving you a competitive edge. By continuously monitoring industry trends, analyzing consumer behavior, and adapting your website accordingly, you can ensure that you remain relevant and meet the evolving needs of your target audience.

**Conclusion**

In conclusion, a good website is a fundamental asset for individuals and businesses looking to thrive in the digital world. It not only establishes credibility and trust but also expands your reach, enhances brand awareness, increases customer engagement, generates leads, drives conversions, improves search engine visibility, and helps you stay competitive. By investing in a well-designed and optimized website, you are investing in the success and growth of your online endeavors.

**FAQs**

1. **Q:** Do I need a website if I have a strong social media presence?
   **A:** While a strong social media presence is beneficial, having a website provides you with more control over your online presence and allows for better customization and branding.

2. **Q:** How long does it take to build a good website?
   **A:** The time it takes to build a website depends on its complexity and the resources available. It can range from a few days to several weeks or months.

`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"In today's digital age, having a good website is no longer a luxury but a necessity for businesses and individuals alike. A well-designed and optimized website can make a significant difference in the success of your online endeavors. Whether you're a small business owner, a freelancer, or an aspiring blogger, a good website can serve as your virtual storefront, attracting visitors, engaging customers, and driving conversions. In this article, we will explore the reasons why having a good website is crucial in today's competitive online landscape."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"F:\\NEXT\\knockbot2.0\\src\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36ec7cd5-8d74-4be8-8183-295cf9fb6c67.mdx",lineNumber:46,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"One of the primary reasons why you need a good website is to establish credibility and trust with your audience. In the digital realm, your website acts as a representation of your brand or business. A professional and visually appealing website instills confidence in your potential customers, giving them the assurance that you are a legitimate and trustworthy entity. Without a well-designed website, you risk losing customers to competitors who have already established a strong online presence."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"F:\\NEXT\\knockbot2.0\\src\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36ec7cd5-8d74-4be8-8183-295cf9fb6c67.mdx",lineNumber:50,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Additionally, a good website enables you to expand your reach beyond geographical boundaries. `,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Furthermore, a well-crafted website enhances brand awareness. structuredData.headline: Why You Need a Good Website

document.title: Setup twrnc with expo project.
document.description: Learn how to easily setup a expo project with tailwindcss.

body.raw:
<Image
  src="/images/blog/setup-tailwind-with-react-native-expo/thumbnail.png"
  width={720}
  height={720}
/>

## Introduction

Tailwind CSS has given us a lot of freedom in how we design web components. As a result, it has gained widespread acceptability among developers and IT enterprises.

Tailwind CSS is a highly flexible, low-level, utility-first CSS framework for creating user interfaces quickly.

React Native combines the greatest aspects of native development with React, a world-class JavaScript library for developing user interfaces.

## Installation

First we need to install the `twrnc` package by the following command.

```bash
npm install twrnc
```

## Intellisense

To get proper intellisense in vscode read the following instructions.

- Install [Tailwind CSS IntelliSense](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=bradlc.vscode-tailwindcss) plugin.
- Go to `settings.json` and paste the following code.

```json title="settings.json"
"tailwindCSS.classAttributes": [
    // ...
    "style"
],
// ...
"tailwindCSS.experimental.classRegex": [
    "tw`([^`]*)", // tw`...`
    "tw=\"([^\"]*)", // <div tw="..." />
    "tw={\"([^\"}]*)", // <div tw={"..."} />
    "tw\\.\\w+`([^`]*)", // tw.xxx`...`
    "tw\\(.*?\\)`([^`]*)" // tw(Component)`...`
]
// ...
```

## Usage

You can import the main `tw` function and reach for tw.style only when you need it:

```jsx title="App.js"
import tw from "twrnc";

const MyComponent = () => (
  <View style={tw`bg-blue-100`}>
    <Text style={tw.style("text-md", invalid && "text-red-500")}>Hello</Text>
  </View>
);
```

...or if the tagged template function isn't your cup of tea, just import tw.style as tw:

```jsx title="App.js"
import { style as tw } from "twrnc";

const MyComponent = () => (
  <View style={tw("bg-blue-100", invalid && "text-red-500")}></View>
);
```

## Customizations

You can use twrnc right out of the box if you haven't customized your `tailwind.config.js` file at all. But more likely you've got some important app-specific tailwind customizations you'd like to use. For that reason, we expose the ability to create a **custom configured version** of the tw function object.

```jsx title="lib/tailwind.js"
import { create } from "twrnc";

// create the customized version...
const tw = create(require(`../../tailwind.config.js`)); // <- your path may differ

// ... and then this becomes the main function your app uses
export default tw;
```

...and in your component files import your own customized version of the function instead:

```jsx title="something.js"
import tw from "./lib/tailwind";
```

<Callout emoji="âš ">
  Make sure to use `module.exports = {}` instead of `export default {}` in your
  `tailwind.config.js` file, as the latter is not supported.
</Callout>

## Adding custom classes

To add custom utilities, use the [plugin method](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/adding-new-utilities#using-a-plugin) described in the tailwind docs, instead of writing to a `.css` file.

```jsx title="tailwind.config.js"
const plugin = require("tailwindcss/plugin");

module.exports = {
  plugins: [
    plugin(({ addUtilities }) => {
      addUtilities({
        ".btn": {
          padding: 3,
          borderRadius: 10,
          textTransform: `uppercase`,
          backgroundColor: `#333`,
        },
        ".resize-repeat": {
          resizeMode: `repeat`,
        },
      });
    }),
  ],
};
```
